Him JUSTlN182. Is your blu-ray player AVCHD compatible? Most are, but not all. You'd need to check your user manual or look for the spec's online for that information.

I just want to add.

Hi Failz0r - I'm not sure which audio codec pack/filters you are using, or what your setup is, so it's a little hard for me to offer help, but the audio track is 6 channel and you are only hearing the lower frequency channels, so the chances are, you're either using a 5.1 speaker system, but your computer is setup for 2/2.1 channel/s, or more likely, your computer's speaker system is only 2 channel, but your audio codecs/sound card are set up for 5.1 surround sound.

I hope this helps - all the best.

Just wondering if this has the actual 5.1 channel DTS soundtrack converted to ac3 or is it Just 2.1 expanded to 5.1. This Is very important for me so if someone could confirm one or the other. keep up the good work HD R US

kenney303 - We'd never consider up-converting from 2.1 channels to 5.1 channels. All of our releases are either left in original DTS format, or converted from 6 channel DTS to 6 channel ac3. I hope this helps.
